Description: Fragment of undyed, plain weave linen tunic (a) with two ovoid/leaf-shaped panels (b); (a) sewn on two sides with self-stripes in groups of threes, self-stripes several picks used together in 3 or 4 consecutive sheds; Warp: S spun, c. 14 tpc; Weft: S spun, c. 10 tpc; Edges: 1 selvedge, 3 cut; Sewing: edge with selvedge hemmed in overcasting with running stitch, remains of double seam - two rows of overcasting, (b) attached with overcasting, thread of S spun, Z ply linen; (b) two matching leaf-shaped panels with tapestry (plied warp threads) in wool completely lost; Design of paired cocks, in the upper half addorsed, in the lower confronted, stylised plant motifs between; Warp: S spun, tight Z ply, c. 10 tpc; Weft: S spun, c. 45 tpc
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, green box; Edges cut since excavation; Lower part of child's tunic; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (7.9.1989)
Condition: (a) Good, limited areas of decay; (b) Fair, but wool completely rotted away; Unknown daten a patch of sticky net applied
Acquisition notes: Collection purchased at sale on 6th Dec 1954, lots 154, 155 and 156.
